data.title: Pricey for the quality
data.text:
Let's start with the good points, the service was great, the wines too. 
On the average points, the oysters were alright. The snapper I had was alright, but a little dry.
On the bad points, the shark ceviche (they call it that), was taste less, mushy and lacking lime, lemon and cilantro. It was of the worst I ever tried.

data.title: Excellent lunch
data.text: We had a weekday lunch here with a family member we were visiting. Everything about our experience was great. The atmosphere was very inviting, the service was impeccable, menu selections were varied and very reasonable priced. I would recommend to anyone and hope to return here the next time we're in Auburn.

data.title: Bringing back memories
data.text: As an ex railroad engineer I enjoyed being taken back to my railroad days. The oysters and tuna appetizers were fresh and tasty. The tuna needed to be chilled. It was served room temperature. The oysters were perfectly presented. I lobster bisque was excellent. The entrees were well prepared but I prefer my food plated separately and not combined in a bowl. I know this is popular but I prefer to taste my food individually. The blackened Barramundi was clearly the best dish of the night. The chocolate mouse was exceptional. I pleasant dining experience. Rich J.

data.title: Brunch
data.text: Great place to brunch. Located next to the train tracks in a very quaint depot. Decor so fitting and tasteful. Food delicious!  Ate at the bar and had great service. Crab cake, French toast, eggs Rockefeller- all great!  Eric was awesome!

data.title: Will not to back
data.text: I eat out in auburn twice a week. I typically dine at acre or the hound and enjoy them. However, I heard that the depot was a good place to try. The first time I went there, it was mediocre food and service so I decided to give it another try. When I went again it was a horrible experience. It took 40 minutes to be seated (even with a reservation). Some of our party's food came out raw while the salmon  was very bland and the gumbo had to be sent back because it was cold. Typically, I do not mind paying for expensive  food because I appreciate the good quality and understand that sometimes means small portions.  But, the portions were tiny. Even after ordering appetizers and entrees our entire party was hungry right after dinner due to the tiny portions. My advice is to save your money and skip the depot in auburn.

data.title: Not impressed!
data.text: We have been coming to Auburn for 30 years since my husband and I went to school here. We now have children at Auburn University. We usually eat at Acre or The Hound but have tried The Depot twice now. The first time, the brunch was "so so" and we had to send the stuffed sausage side back because it was very obviously raw. The manager came to the table to apologize and brought a new order of "cooked" sausage but we were still charged. No biggie. We decided to try it again tonight with 6 friends.  The waloo had good flavor but it was very rare (not supposed to be) in the middle. In comparison to Acre, the salmon was very mediocre. One friends gumbo was cold. After eating, having wine and visiting for a brief time, the same manager came to our table to ask how our meal was. We told him it was good (being nice) and then he told us they had a 8:00 reservation and we would need to leave our table. It was 8:08. We have traveled extensively and have eaten in fine dining restaurants all over, and have NEVER been asked to leave a restaurant because there was another reservation. In the waiting area, there were four people and 3 empty tables in the middle section. You all need to step it up. Very disappointing!

data.title: Great seafood in Auburn
data.text: The Depot should have more reviews because its a fabulous restaurant in Downtown Auburn that me and my husband go on date night because we always leave satisfied with the food and service and price of course! This seafood restaurant offers Brunch, Lunch and Dinner, they always have free parking, and a wonderful wine list that theyre happy to pair with your menu selections. The best oysters ever.

data.title: Amazing Food, Atmosphere and Service
data.text: I ate at The Depot for a celebration a few nights ago and had an amazing experience! The variety of seafood available and the way it was cooked was great. The Atmosphere in the restaurant was breathtaking from the massive chandelier to the occasional train passing by that would shake the building. The bar selection was the best I've seen in a long time. The service was top notch as well. My water glass was never empty, all my questions were answered about the dishes and the food arrived on time. We had such an amazing time and will certainly be stopping by again!!

data.title: WORST EVER
data.text: We got our appetizers and left, the Oysters Rockefeller had a burnt plastic smell and a repulsive taste, my son got the lobster bisque which was a suspicious dark brown and inedible, and finally my wife got some beautiful fresh oysters with "their take on cocktail sauce" well let's just say that anything can be ruined at this restaurant. Great atmosphere but the chef is totally lost.

data.title: Great food and good to see this historic landmark being used.
data.text: Nice menu for food and drinks and enjoyable atmosphere. Service was fine and prices about what we expected.

data.title: Good food and Bourbon
data.text: I've been here on several occasions and have had really good and unique meals.  I love shell fish, but don't typically care for fish that much.  I will eat it, but it is not my go-to meal.  They have had some fish dishes that were amazing and I never regret ordering there.  The bourbon and drink menu is always on point.  It is loud, but also neat when the train goes by during your meal.

data.title: Brunch was yummy
data.text: The Depot has brunch on both Saturday and Sunday. Today they had a Bloody Mary bar which had just about every addition and garnish you could ever hope to have.  We started with the blue crab dip which had chorizo on top, it was an amazing party in my mouth!  I ordered the French toast which was amazing, the bread was fresh, cooked to perfection, the white chocolate whipped wonderfulness on top was not too sweet but was clearly made fresh and a great compliment to the strawberries and toast. My daughter had the crab and shrimp grits and she had nothing but good things to say about the tastiness of her dish. The most expensive item was the Bloody Mary but it was a substantial drink, I had to leave a third of it because I was so full at the end of brunch.  We made reservations but, it's fall break so there was no wait. I'm sure during regular game weekends this place is packed. The building is beautifully renovated and I was so glad to see the train depot rehabilitated into such a great space.

data.title: Top  Notch!!
data.text: Fabulous!!! Wood fire grilled Oysters Rockefeller appetizers! I had Grilled, Crab Stuffed Pompano w/heirloom tomato salad and grilled asparagus. Susan had the Brick Grilled Half Chicken w/Bourbon Peppercorn Sauce!! Desserts were awesome, also! Valet parking, very nice for anyone who knows what a pain parking can be in downtown Auburn! Wait staff was perfect and very friendly!

data.title: Lovely Evening with Friends
data.text: I loved the atmosphere and the decor of the restaurant.  We had a lovely dinner with friends.  The food was wonderful, the drinks were awesome and the staff was on mark.

data.title: Pre game lunch in a relaxed atmosphere.
data.text: We decided not to tail gate before the LSU game and escaped the heat into The Depot Restaurant.  It was a relaxed, beautifully decorated train depot.  We enjoyed the local caramel, white stout that was incredible.  We had a delicious grilled Kobe burger, the goat cheese salad and the oyster po boy were great.  Thank you for great service and War Eagle!!

data.title: Competes in quality with top restaurants anywhere
data.text: All round delight, starting with cocktails at the bar through to desert, small but well priced wine list

data.title: The Depot is truly wonderful!
data.text: We chose The Depot as the location to celebrate my mother-in-law's birthday (small party of 4) because of glowing recommendations.  Sometimes it is hard to trust glowing recommendations but not it this case.  Four fairly hard-to-please people ordered different entrees and four people were ecstatic over their choices.  The appetizers, the entrees, the sides, the desserts, the wine list, and the service were all top notch.  I highly recommend this place.

data.title: Classy, delicious, well-priced, long-awaited!
data.text: First off: food is great.  I had a fried oyster po' boy, my sister had the mahi tuna sandwich and my dad had simple fish and chips.  All were very good- fresh, hot, super tasty!  The price is midrange, but the food is top notch (hence I gave the 5/5.)  We went on a Thursday at lunch, had great service.  The inside is fun to look at with the train and nautical themes.  It is nice enough for a date to impress and informal enough to go with your family.  I can't wait to go back and try osso bucco to see if they will still keep my 5/5 rating.

data.title: Not the greatest seafood, but good for Auburn
data.text:
The Depot offers a peaceful Saturday morning brunch away from the crowded restaurants and hour-long waits on game day at Auburn University. The menu is creative and reasonably priced, the service is phenomenal, and the ambiance is incredibly charming.

Auburn's train station built in 1904 was extensively remodeled and reopened as The Depot Restaurant during the summer of 2016. The interior design fuses modern opulence with the preservation of historic aspects of the original train station, including the most marvelous chandelier, original fireplace and towering ceilings.

The menu is intriguing and concocted by California chef Scott Simpson. Certainly nobody is doing high brow seafood in this part of Alabama like The Depot.

The crab dip appetizer was perfectly spicy with well-balanced flavors and ample crab meat, although I hoped for a few large pieces of crab. The dip was topped with a delectable Mexican sausage and came with deliciously crafted chips. The amberjack was flaky and tender but the outer edges were a little tough and dry.

The gumbo was the only disappointment here. I've tasted a vast variety of this dish in so many places, especially in Louisiana where its authenticity is unmatched! While I appreciated the okra and occasional lumps of crawfish, shrimp, and Andouille, it was more of a liquid soup than a solid stew, with far too much broth that comes off as incredibly strong and overpowering. It's simply not gumbo and it has all the wrong flavors with not enough meat.

This is a pleasant stop on your way to the Auburn campus and worth a visit. The food just needs some tweaking. I'll try the wide variety of oysters next time and post an update.

data.title: Huge Thanks for a big group of VERY happy diners.
data.text: Our group has been gathering for dinner every Friday night before a home game for several years. I think I can speak for all of my group and say that this past Friday night at The Depot was THE BEST outing we've ever had. The room, the table set up, the food but especially the service was A+! Thanks to Richard (The Manager) for making it so easy with your suggestions and for going the extra mile to make sure everything was perfect!
